description: The round payoff this round was 5. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 0.

The game’s payoff structure creates a high-risk, high-reward situation where unilateral deviation (choosing option 2 while the opponent chooses option 1) can secure a positive payoff equal to the round input, but simultaneous deviation (both choosing option 2) results in massive losses due to the 1000× multiplier.

Deepseek-R1’s tendency to mostly choose option 1 suggests it is predictable, which might allow an exploitable advantage if one anticipates its actions; however, since it also has access to your API, it might adjust its behavior if it detects exploitation.

The historical memory from 2024-01-02, where both players chose option 1 leading to a safe payoff of 0 despite a round input of 5, demonstrates one instance of risk-averse behavior—highlighting that playing safe (option 1) avoids losses but foregoes potential gains from a unilateral move with option 2.
